intro: Loeflingia baetica subsp. baetica, commonly known as the Baetica bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe, particularly Spain and southern France. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. It has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it is considered rare in the wild.
